column4: hey guys, i'm having some trouble using dpkg -i x.deb myself, I tried installing build-essentials which I downloaded from the ubuntu site, but when I do sudo dpkg -i build.deb it says it can't configure because of dependencies
why not just do this? sudo aptitude install build-essentials
i don't have internet in ubuntu, trying to get wireless card to work heh
well, you need to have all the dependencies in the same directory if you are going to install it manually then
do you mean if i want to install build-essentials, i would also need libc6-dev, g++, etc. in the same directory? the .deb files i mean
k i'll give that a try
because build-essential itself is not a real package, it's a metapackage used to bring in all the others .. and anyway, if a package depends on something, it needs to be there
no dice on the dpkg -i build-essential.deb, even though i had all the packages it needed in the same directory
please don't be vague, i cant see your screen to tell you what to do next -- give me error messages :)
k one sec let me get it
if you want to paste, use a !pastebin
can you paste the output of this command too?  ls -l *.deb
alright, give me a sec i gotta boot ubuntu and then boot back
